meanings.definition: A person who regularly frequents a particular place.
meanings.sent1: The habitues of the library always find a cozy spot to read their books.
meanings.sent2: The habitues of the park enjoy their daily walks and picnics.
meanings.sent3: The habitues of the coffee shop were so familiar with the menu, they could order blindfolded!
meanings.sent4: The habitues of the gym were like dedicated athletes, showing up rain or shine.
meanings.sent5: The habitues of the theater created a warm and welcoming atmosphere for all visitors.

meanings.definition: Those who are regular customers or patrons of a business or establishment.
meanings.sent1: The habitues of the bakery always left with bags full of freshly baked goods.
meanings.sent2: The habitues of the local diner knew all the staff by name.
meanings.sent3: The habitues of the ice cream shop had a sweet tooth that never seemed to be satisfied!
meanings.sent4: The habitues of the bookstore were like treasure hunters, always discovering new reads.
meanings.sent5: The habitues of the farmer's market enjoyed the vibrant atmosphere and fresh produce.
